intro: Astragalus lenensis, commonly known as the Lenenskaya milkvetch, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family Fabaceae. It is native to Central Asia and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and compound leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Astragalus lenensis is known for its ability to fix nitrogen through symbiotic relationships with rhizobia bacteria in its root nodules. This species is of interest in botanical studies due to its ecological adaptations and potential medicinal properties.
